title: 3 Best Ways to Move Spotify Playlists to Apple Music

steps.title: Install the FreeYourMusic app.
steps.content: Install the FreeYourMusic app. This app makes transferring Spotify playlists to Apple Music , YouTube Music , and other streaming services a breeze. You can install the app on Windows, Mac, or Linux, as well as on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. To get started, go to https://freeyourmusic.com , select your platform, and download the app. FreeYourMusic allows you to transfer one playlist containing up to 100 songs to Apple Music for free. You'll need to upgrade to a paid plan to transfer more music. [1] X Research source On a computer, you can double-click the downloaded file to run FreeYourMusic.

steps.title: Connect Spotify to FreeYourMusic.
steps.content: Connect Spotify to FreeYourMusic. Here's how: Click Spotify . Follow the on-screen instructions to sign in with your Spotify account. Click Agree .

steps.title: Connect Apple Music to FreeYourMusic.
steps.content: Connect Apple Music to FreeYourMusic. Just like with Spotify, click Apple Music , then follow the on-screen instructions to sign in.

steps.title: Select the playlist(s) you want to transfer.
steps.content: Select the playlist(s) you want to transfer. Tap Playlists at the top to filter your Spotify content to show only playlists, then tap the playlists you want to move to Apple Music.

steps.title: Tap Begin Transfer.
steps.content: Tap Begin Transfer . This instantly transfers your playlists from Spotify to Apple Music. Once the transfer is complete, you'll find your playlists in the Playlists section of your Apple Music library.

steps.title: Install SongShift from the App Store.
steps.content: Install SongShift from the App Store. SongShift makes it easy to transfer your Spotify playlist to Apple Music, Tidal, YouTube Music, and many other streaming services. [2] X Research source With a free account, you can transfer one Spotify playlist to Apple Music at a time. You'll have the option to upgrade to a Pro subscription to transfer multiple playlists at once.

steps.title: Open SongShift and connect to Spotify.
steps.content: Open SongShift and connect to Spotify. Before you can transfer your playlists, you'll need to permit SongShift to access your Spotify library. Here's how: Tap Spotify in SongShift. Tap Agree . Once authorized, you'll return to the list of streaming services.

steps.title: Connect SongShift to Apple Music.
steps.content: Connect SongShift to Apple Music. As you did with Spotify, tap Apple Music , and follow the on-screen instructions to give SongShift access to your library. Once you've approved both services, you can transfer playlists between the two.

steps.title: Tap Continue and then Get Started.
steps.content: Tap Continue and then Get Started .

steps.title: Select the playlist(s) you want to transfer.
steps.content: Select the playlist(s) you want to transfer. Tap the + at the top to open the "Add Shifts" screen. Tap Playlist under "Spotify." A list of your Spotify playlists will appear. Select a playlist and tap Confirm . If you have a Pro subscription, you can select multiple playlists .

steps.title: Select Apple Music.
steps.content: Select Apple Music . You'll now see the selected playlist(s) queued for transfer.

steps.title: Tap Start Shifts to check for playlist matches.
steps.content: Tap Start Shifts to check for playlist matches. You'll see "Matching" while SongShift is searching for matching songs on Apple Music. Once matching is complete, the status will change to "Review." Some songs from Spotify are not on Apple Music. If your playlist contains songs that don't have Apple Music matches, they'll be omitted from the playlist.

steps.title: Tap Review to review your matches.
steps.content: Tap Review to review your matches. If you see any songs under "Failed Matches," those songs don't have equivalents on Apple Music. You can either tap Ignore to remove them from the Apple Music version of the playlist or Re-match to try again. If you see any matches that don't look right, tap the pencil icon next to the songs to edit them.

steps.title: Tap Confirm Matches to start the transfer.
steps.content: Tap Confirm Matches to start the transfer. Once confirmed, your playlist will transfer. You can keep track of the progress in the blue box at the top of the app. Once the process is complete, you'll find your Spotify playlist in Apple Music.

steps.title: Create an account at https://www.soundiiz.com.
steps.content: Create an account at https://www.soundiiz.com . Soundiiz is a web-based streaming service transfer tool that can easily transfer your playlists from Spotify to your preferred streaming service. You can transfer playlists individually for free if your playlists don't exceed 200 songs. [3] X Research source If you want to transfer larger playlists or multiple playlists at once, you'll need to pay for a subscription. To sign up: Go to https://soundiiz.com/register . Click Sign in with Spotify . If prompted, Log in to your Spotify account, then click Agree . You'll now see a list of your Spotify playlists, along with icons for other streaming services running along the left side of the page.

steps.title: Connect Soundiiz to Apple Music.
steps.content: Connect Soundiiz to Apple Music. Click the Apple Music icon in the left panel. Click Connect and sign in to Apple Music. Follow the on-screen instructions to enter your Apple Music login details and give permission for Soundiiz to access your library .

steps.title: Select a playlist(s) and click Transfer.
steps.content: Select a playlist(s) and click Transfer . Click the checkbox next to the playlist you want to move to Apple Music. If you're not paying for an upgrade, choose a playlist with fewer than 200 songs. Once you've selected a playlist, click Transfer in the left panel.

steps.title: Set the Source as "Spotify" and the Destination as "Apple Music."
steps.content: Set the Source as "Spotify" and the Destination as "Apple Music." Once you've set your source and destination, you'll see "Connected" on both tiles.

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . A list of categories will appear.

steps.title: Click Playlists and then Confirm my selection.
steps.content: Click Playlists and then Confirm my selection . You can now edit the name and description of the playlist if you'd like.

steps.title: Click Save configuration.
steps.content: Click Save configuration .

steps.title: Click Confirm and then Begin the Transfer.
steps.content: Click Confirm and then Begin the Transfer . This transfers the selected playlist(s) to Apple Music from Spotify. Once the transfer is complete, you'll find your playlist in the Playlists section of Apple Music.
